page.title: 16The Exeter ship canal
page.content: The first canal was built by John Trew in 1566 and was the first lock canal in the country. It linked the seaport of Topsham to the trading centre of Exeter. Trade expanded mainly due to a thriving woollen industry and in 1675 the canal was extended across the Exminster marshes. The present canal was completed in 1827 and was designed by the prominent canal builder, James Green. By 1960 the canal ceased to be a trading waterway. It is now a centre for leisure activities. The canal is in need of development, resturation and improvement and the Exeter canal and quay development trust, a registered charity has been form for this purpose.
